content: Diamond PI George Biros is co-organizing the IPAM Workshop on HPC and Data Science for Scientific Discovery.
Diamond PI Youssef Marzouk is a Program Leader for the 2018-2019 SAMSI year-long program on Model Uncertainty: Mathematical and Statistical
Diamond PIs Omar Ghattas and Youssef Marzouk are co-organizing the 2018 Gene Golub SIAM Summer School Inverse Problems: Systematic Integration of Data with Models under Uncertainty (http://g2s3.com/)
Diamond PI Karen Willcox is co-organizing the IMA workshop Integrating Machine Learning and Simulation: From Uncertainty Quantification to Digital Twins
Diamond PI George Biros is co-organizing the BIRS workshop on Complex Creeping Fluids: Numerical Methods and Theory
Diamond PI Youssef Marzouk is co-organizing the AMSI Winter School 2017 on Computational Foundations of Data Science
DiaMonD All-Hands Meeting

The DiaMonD team is organizing 11 minisymposia at SIAM CSE 2017:
MS272 : Recent Advances in Computational Subsurface Hydraulic Modeling and Analysis
MS165 and MS192 : Efficient Algorithms for Bayesian Inverse Problems Governed by PDE Forward Problems
MS299 and MS326 : Bayesian Optimal Experimental Design for ODE/PDE Models
MS158 and MS185 : Multi-Fidelity and Multi-Information-Source Methods
MS17 and MS46 : Advances in MCMC and Related Sampling Methods for Large-Scale Inverse Problems
MS29 and MS58 : Measure Transport Approaches for Statistical Problems
MS220 and MS246 : Adaptive Methods for Uncertainty Quantification and Error Estimation
MS160 and MS187 : Fast Solvers for Large-Scale Inverse Problems in Imaging
MS8, MS37, and MS66 : Smooth, Reduced, Sparse -- Exploiting Structures for Surrogate Modeling in CSE
MS86 : Methods for Data-driven Uncertainty Quantification of Large-scale Complex Dynamic Systems
MS201 and MS227 : PDE-Constrained Optimal Control Under Uncertainty
AGU 2016 session: Transforming hydrologic prediction and decision making through theoretical innovations, collaborative integrated modeling and cyberinfrastructure for data and model sharing
Workshop on Uncertainty Quantification, Mittag-Leffler Institute, Stockholm, Sweden

The DiaMonD team is organizing six minisymposia at SIAM UQ 2016: (1) Low rank and sparse structure in Bayesian computation, (2) Bayesian inverse problems beyond the conventional setting, (3) Bayesian inversion and low-rank approximation, (4) Advances in sampling methods for Bayesian inverse problems, (5) Advances in optimal experimental design for physical models, (6) Goal-oriented decision making under uncertainty
AGU 2015 session: Concepts and Practice of Model Verification, Validation, and Uncertainty Quantification in Computational Geosciences
SciCADE 2015: Advances in Bayesian computation for large-scale differential equation models.
The DiaMonD team is organizing two minisymposia at ICIAM 2015: (1) Advances in MCMC and related sampling methods for large-scale inverse problems, (2) Advances in optimal experimental design
Rocky Mountain Summer Workshop on Uncertainty Quantification
Diamond PI Youssef Marzouk is teaching the IMA short course Introduction to Uncertainty Quantification
Diamond PIs Omar Ghattas and Youssef Marzouk are co-organizing IdeaLab 2015: Inverse Problems and Uncertainty Quantification at ICERM.

The DiaMonD team is organizing four minisymposia at SIAM CSE 2015: (1) Advances in uncertainty quantification for large-scale inverse problems, (2) Challenges in optimization with uncertain and noisy data, (3) Advances in Algorithms for Uncertainty Quantification in Large- scale Inverse Problems, (4) Efficient Algorithms for Variational Methods in Imaging

The DiaMonD team is organizing five minisymposia at SIAM UQ 2014: (1) Advances in MCMC methods for large-scale inverse problems, (2) Surrogate and reduced-order modeling for inference and prediction, (3) Advances in optimal experimental design, (4) Active subspace methods for high-dimensional approximation, (5) High performance computing meets uncertainty quantification
DiaMonD All-Hands Meeting
DiaMonD All-Hands Meeting
Workshop on Large-Scale Inverse Problems and Quantification of Uncertainty: Big Data Meets Big Models
The DiaMonD team is organizing the minisymposium "Numerical methods for stochastic inverse problems" at SIAM CSE 2013.
